text.en: In this challenge you will learn about torque. Torque is actually the turning effect of a force.
Review: To increase speed, you need to attach a bigger driver gear to a smaller driven gear.
Review: To decrease speed, you need to do the opposite - attach a smaller driver gear to a bigger driven gear.

Before moving on, let's learn about power a bit.
Power is equal to torque times angular speed.
P=T*w
To keep the power on the same level, the increased torque will result in decreased speed.
If you double the torque, angular speed will slow down by 50%.

There are several situations when torque is more important than speed. Imagine that you are cycling up a hill. By choosing the right gear, your speed will slow down and torque will increase. It will help you moving upward easily.
Speed and torque have a reverse relationship. The faster you are, the lower the torque will be. However, when torque increases, speed decreases.
Build the highest torque using two of the standard gears from your kit.
The highest torque can be generated by attaching a 20-tooth driver gear to a 60-tooth driven gear.
